segment.source: OperatingSystem - Device Report (Windows 10)
segment.target: OperatingSystem - Device Report (Windows 10)

segment.source: OperatingSystem - Device Report
segment.target: OperatingSystem - Device Report

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: The OperatingSystem - Device Report screen shows the following information for each device installed in your organization:
segment.target: The OperatingSystem - Device Report screen shows the following information for each device installed in your organization:

segment.source: The model and manufacturer of the device.
segment.target: The model and manufacturer of the device.

segment.source: The class of device, as reported by the device.
segment.target: The class of device, as reported by the device.

segment.source: An evaluation from the device manufacturer of whether the device works on a 32-bit operating system or a 64-bit operating system.
segment.target: An evaluation from the device manufacturer of whether the device works on a 32-bit operating system or a 64-bit operating system.

segment.source: The count of computers on which the device is installed.
segment.target: The count of computers on which the device is installed.

segment.source: To open the OperatingSystem - Device Report screen
segment.target: To open the OperatingSystem - Device Report screen

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), on the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), on the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.

segment.source: In the Quick Reports pane, under an operating system heading, click Devices.
segment.target: In the Quick Reports pane, under an operating system heading, click Devices.

segment.source: Using the OperatingSystem - Device Report Screen
segment.target: Using the OperatingSystem - Device Report Screen

segment.source: On the OperatingSystem - Device Report screen, you can:
segment.target: On the OperatingSystem - Device Report screen, you can:

segment.source: Export the report data to a spreadsheet, or import a report.
segment.target: Export the report data to a spreadsheet, or import a report.

segment.source: For more information, see Saving, Opening, and Exporting Reports.
segment.target: For more information, see Saving, Opening, and Exporting Reports.

segment.source: Synchronize your compatibility issues by using the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Synchronize your compatibility issues by using the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: For more information, see Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Filter the report by using the query builder.
segment.target: Filter the report by using the query builder.

segment.source: For more information, see Filtering Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Filtering Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Assign categories and subcategories to a device.
segment.target: Assign categories and subcategories to a device.

segment.source: For more information, see Categorizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Categorizing Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Specify the importance of a device to your organization.
segment.target: Specify the importance of a device to your organization.

segment.source: For more information, see Prioritizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Prioritizing Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Double-click a device name to view its associated dialog box.
segment.target: Double-click a device name to view its associated dialog box.

segment.source: For more information, see Device Dialog Box.
segment.target: For more information, see Device Dialog Box.
